{"step_by_step_thinking": "Ritodrine is a beta-2 adrenergic agonist that is used to relax the uterus and delay premature labor. Magnesium sulphate is also used to delay labor and protect the baby's brain. Dexamethasone is a corticosteroid that is used to speed up lung development in preterm babies, but it does not directly affect uterine contractility. Methyl alcohol, on the other hand, is not used in preterm labor and does not decrease uterine contractility.", "answer_choice": "A. Methyl alcohol"}
